content.description: Pumpy moves up a corner system that doesn't climb like anything else in the area. The holds are mostly large but the problem is figuring out how to use them. Scramble down from the alcove to reach the first bolt and have your belayer scramble down as well or else you'll suffer from rope drag. Follow some jugs and the corner crack up to the top of the pillar (sling the pillar if you want) and rest up before launching into the downward and right facing corner. Is it a layback? Gaston? Undercling? Figure it out. There is a hidden jug just past the bolt and brings you to the end of the crux. One more trick move lets you stand atop the jug and then up easier ground to the top.
content.protection: 7 or 8 bolts plus a 2 bolt anchor. Bring a sling for the block or a large cam.
content.location: Once you're standing at the Mushroom Wall, scramble down to the left. There is a bolt showing you where to begin. If you fall to the base of the Maple Run wall, then you went too far.

content.description: Technical, vertical face climbing with a couple of short cruxes. Start up the corner until you're directly beneath the bolt line, or climb Riders on the Storm to the first bolt and then follow the bolts straight up. Using a decent hold in the seam, work up the clean face on tiny holds to reach a bad rest on slopers, then make some tricky moves to better holds. Fun climbing on better holds to the anchor.Â
content.protection: A bit runout to the first bolt. Follow bolts to rings at the top.
content.location: Start up the easy corner at the intersection of mushroom wall and the main face. Keep going up till you reach the first rusted cold shut bolt. Clip it, then proceed straight up to bolted anchor.

content.description:
Start by pulling on the huge flake in the diheral leading a bolt. The first moves can be protected by a big cam. Clip that bolt or proceed left to second bolt. The first bolt is not part of this route. If you clip it then unclip it after clipping second bolt to avoid rope drag. After second bolt, proceed straight up.  

  Clip the anchors, have a seat and enjoy a great view.
content.protection: 1 bolt to protect crux. Rest of it is trad, protectable by nuts.
content.location: The route starts at the bottom of where the mushroom wall and main face meet and goes straight up.

content.description: If you like moderate, reachy routes with positive holds, this is the one for you! Start up the right corner of the Mushroom Wall on low-angle slab following the blocky off-width crack (Peggy Lane start). Once half-way to the top-out, at a cluster of small trees, step left up the vertical face on numerous horizontals to a bolted ring anchor.
content.protection: Cams to 2", larger to protect the start.
content.location: Make your way to Craig's Crack, then hike left along the face for another 100' to the Mushroom Wall. Peggy's Pain starts up the obvious corner before striking left up the face.

content.description: Fun climbing up the flake turns into somewhat scary but much easier climbing at the top. Climb the flake to reach the bolt at the crux and navigate rightward with a jug and a few small holds. Once through the crux, the difficulty eases considerably, but you'll want some small pieces to protect you as you climb the face above. Finish straight up to the 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: The leftmost line before dropping down from the alcove. Look for the juggy flake beneath the single, high bolt.

content.description: Steep technical face climbing up a white streak with cool square cut holds. The crux is in the vertical section when the holds get small. Bold sport climbing, can be made safer by adding a trad piece after second bolt. The start is easy but do not fall.
content.protection: Bolts to 2 bolt anchor. Supplement with a few pieces of trad gear if you want.
content.location: This route is to the immediate right of Storm Trooper. Start at the bottom of mushroom wall and climb along the line where mushroom wall and main face meet, 5.4. Go upto a small tree, do 1 move and then clip bolt.

climbs.name: Broken Mirror
climbs.fa: Peter Lataille, WS, CS, SJ, DN 3/28/93

content.description: Gymnastic climbing out the overhang to a powerful crux up the short corner. Start up the corner/crack and figure out how to get to the good jug on the face. Now commit to the climb and swing your feet left. Tricky moves on pinches, sidepulls, crimps will get you to a good rest stance and fun climbing on better holds will get you back to Riders on the Storm to finish up to the anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts through the crux with trad gear at the beginning and end of the climb
content.location: Starts in the corner of the Mushroom wall. Look for a large jug above the roof on the left and a bolt line to the left of it.

content.description: This wall stays shaded. It holds about six routes. The ultra classic Riders of the Storm was the first route to done at Parks.
